Home → Recommendations & reviews → Young Adult

Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

Landscape with Invisible Hand by M. T. Anderson

Written by Kate Ashton · Published May 22, 2018

Landscape with Invisible Hand will appeal to fans of retro science fiction.

I Am Thunder by Muhammad Khan

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published May 17, 2018

I Am Thunder is timely, diverse and has a powerful message.

Goodbye, Perfect, by Sara Barnard

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published May 10, 2018

Goodbye Perfect is a phenomenal dissection of female friendships, loyalty and family.

The List of Real Things by Sarah Moore Fitzgerald

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published May 8, 2018

The List of Real Things is a touching read about life, loss, grief and how truly magical the imagination can really be.

The Sacrifice Box by Martin Stewart

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published May 3, 2018

The Sacrifice Box is a frightening and gripping horror thatâ€™s perfect for a dark night.

Everless by Sara Holland

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published May 1, 2018

Everless is an awesome, fantastic and really riveting debut in a new fantasy series you should keep an eye out for.

New Young Adult books for May 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published Apr 30, 2018

New titles from Louise O'Neill, Becky Albertalli and Sarah J. Maas

Batman: Nightwalker by Marie Lu

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Apr 19, 2018

Batman: Nightwalker is a must-read for anyone looking for a new spin on the infamous Dark Knight.

Second Best Friend by Non Pratt

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Apr 17, 2018

Second Best Friend is a quick, pacey story of friendship, self-discovery and politics, optimised for readers with dyslexia and visual stress.

The Unpredictability of Being Human by Linni Ingemundsen

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Apr 12, 2018

The Unpredictability of Being Human is a relatively quick read with a quirky, relatable main character.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
